Your Financial Guide

Understand funding pathways and prepare an application that’s complete, early, and stress‑free.

NSFAS Overview (2026)

Eligibility

  • South African citizen (or permanent resident)
  • Household income ≤ R350,000 per year (≤ R600,000 if disabled)
  • First‑time entering student at a public University/UoT/TVET
  • Passed Grade 12 and meet the admission requirements
  • Enrolled in an NSFAS‑approved qualification

See application requirements. [1]

Success

Good news

Having Mathematical Literacy does not disqualify you from NSFAS. NSFAS is based on financial need and admission into an approved public qualification, not on specific matric subjects. [1]

Other Funding Avenues

Funza Lushaka Bursary (Teaching)

Covers tuition, accommodation, and a living allowance for B.Ed students. Requires teaching in a public school after graduation (service commitment). Priority area for Foundation Phase teaching.

[2]

University‑specific Bursaries

Most public institutions offer merit‑ and need‑based bursaries. Check each target institution’s Financial Aid page after results release.

Learnerships & Apprenticeships

Work‑based training with a stipend. Valuable for vocational or applied paths that prefer practical experience.

Choosing Your Institution: At a Glance

Institution Type Focus Qualifications Learning Style Best For
University Academic and theoretical Degrees, some Higher Certificates Lectures, research, independent study Professional careers requiring degrees
TVET College Vocational and practical National Certificates, Diplomas Hands‑on, workshop‑based Specific trades and occupations
University of Technology Career‑focused and applied Diplomas and Degrees Theory + practical (work‑integrated learning) Applied routes with industry links

NSFAS Application Checklist

  • Create your myNSFAS account and verify your contact details
  • SA ID or birth certificate (certified copy)
  • Parent/guardian ID (certified copy)
  • Proof of household income (salary slip, SASSA letter, or affidavit)
  • Completed and signed NSFAS consent form
  • Proof of application/acceptance to a public institution
  • Apply as soon as the window opens (expected Sep/Oct for 2026)
  • Double‑check document clarity (no cut‑off edges; readable IDs)
  • Track your status in myNSFAS and your institution portal
  • Keep a single folder with all PDFs/screenshots for quick re‑upload

NSFAS Readiness Check

Not ready • 0/9 complete

Tip: Keep scans as clear PDFs/JPGs. If an upload fails, try a smaller file size and make sure edges aren’t cut off.
